intro: Galium coronatum, commonly known as silverweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant features slender, hairy stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine silver hairs. Native to regions of North America, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium coronatum is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
